nodes.value: Teléfono móvil
mobile phone
A portable telephone
Can you remember life without a mobile phone?
Página web
webpage
A hypertext document connected to the World Wide Web
Do any of your friends have a webpage?
SMS (Mensaje de texto)
SMS (text message)
A short message sent electronically
Do you prefer to send an SMS (text message)?
Enlaces
links
Connections from one web page or document to another
What kind of links do you read interesting?
Blogs
blogs
Regularly updated websites or web pages
Are there any blogs that you read regularly?
Chatear en línea
chat online
To take part in an exchange of remarks over the internet
Do you like to chat online?
Acabas de comprar
just bought
Recently purchased
Tell me about something you have just bought.
Aún no has comprado
haven’t bought yet
Not purchased up to the present time
What is something you haven’t bought yet, but would like to?
Ya has pasado/gastado
already spent
Previously used or consumed (time/money)
Think of a place where you have already spent a lot of time.
Aún no has ido
haven’t been to yet
Not visited up to the present time
Name something you haven’t been to yet, but you plan to.
Acabas de terminar
just finished
Recently completed
What is something you have just finished?
Ya has hecho
done already
Completed prior to the present moment
What is something you have done already today?
Nervioso/a
nervous
Easily agitated or alarmed; anxious
I feel nervous when I have to do an exam.
Solitario/a
lonely
Sad because one has no friends or company
I feel lonely when all my friends are busy.
Aburrido/a
bored
Feeling weary and restless through lack of interest
I feel bored when I have nothing to do.
Incómodo/a
uncomfortable
Causing or feeling slight pain or physical discomfort; uneasy
I feel uncomfortable when I'm in a crowded place.
Confundido/a
confused
Unable to think clearly or to understand something
I feel confused when the instructions are not clear.
Preocupado/a
worried
Feeling anxious or troubled about actual/potential problems
I feel worried when I'm waiting for important news.
Asombrado/a
amazed
Greatly surprised; filled with astonishment
I feel amazed when I see a beautiful sunset.
Emocionado/a
excited
Feeling very enthusiastic and eager
I feel excited when I'm about to go on holiday.
Supersticiones
superstitions
Beliefs not based on reason or knowledge
Do you have the same superstitions in your country?
Trabajo en el extranjero
job abroad
Employment in a foreign country
I might find a job abroad.
Consecuencias
consequences
Results or effects of an action or condition
Discuss the possible consequences.
Mudarse de casa
move house
To change one's place of residence
If I get the job abroad, I'll have to move house.
Sitios para compartir videos
video sharing sites
Websites that allow users to upload and view videos
I think video sharing sites can be dangerous.
Peligroso
dangerous
Able or likely to cause harm or injury
These sites can be dangerous.
Subir videos
upload videos
To transfer video files from one's device to an online platform
Anyone can upload videos of illegal things.
Cosas ilegales
illegal things
Activities or items that are against the law
They might upload videos of illegal things.
¿Puedes recordar la vida sin un teléfono móvil? ¿Usas uno todos los días?
Can you remember life without a mobile phone? Do you use one every day?
¿Alguno de tus amigos tiene una página web?
Do any of your friends have a webpage?
¿Prefieres hablar con alguien por teléfono o enviar un SMS (mensaje de texto)?
Do you prefer to speak to someone on the phone or send an SMS (text message)?
¿Qué tipo de enlaces lees interesantes?
What kind of links do you read interesting?
¿Hay algún blog que leas regularmente? ¿Por qué te gustan?
Are there any blogs that you read regularly? Why do you like them?
¿Te gusta chatear en línea?
Do you like to chat online?
A: Un coche nuevo. - ¿Acabas de comprar uno? B: Así es. A: ¿Qué tipo de coche compraste? B: Un Peugeot.
A: A new car. - Have you just bought one? B: That's right. A: What kind of car did you buy? B: A Peugeot.
Si rompes un espejo, tendrás siete años de mala suerte.
If you break a mirror, you will have seven years’ bad luck.
Si caminas debajo de una escalera, te podría caer pintura en la cabeza.
If you walk under a ladder, paint might fall on your head.
Si encuentras un penique en el suelo, tendrás buena suerte todo el día.
If you find a penny on the floor, you will have good luck all day.
Si comes una manzana al día, mantendrá alejado al médico.
If you eat an apple a day, it will keep the doctor away.
Si regalas un regalo de bodas (ya recibido), tu matrimonio fracasará.
If you give away a wedding present, your marriage will fail.
Si un bebé nace a las 12 en punto, será muy afortunado/a cuando crezca.
If a baby is born at 12 o’clock, he/she will be very lucky when he/she grows up.
A: Podría encontrar un trabajo en el extranjero. B: ¿Qué pasará si haces eso? A: Tendré que mudarme de casa.
A: I might find a job abroad. B: What will happen if you do that? A: I'll have to move house.
A: Creo que los sitios para compartir videos son malos para los niños. B: Me temo que estoy totalmente en desacuerdo.
A: I think video sharing sites are bad for children. B: I'm afraid I totally disagree.
A: Nadie debería comer carne. B: No estoy seguro/a de eso.
A: Nobody should eat meat. B: I'm not sure about that.
A: En mi opinión, todas las drogas deberían ser legales. B: Lo siento, pero no creo que sea una buena idea.
A: In my opinion, all drugs should be legal. B: I'm sorry, but I don't think that's a good idea.
A: Realmente creo que a los profesores se les debería pagar más dinero. B: Yo también lo creo.
A: I really think teachers should be paid more money. B: I think so too.
A: ¿Crees que el próximo gobierno será mejor? B: ¡Definitivamente!
A: Do you think the next government will be better? B: Definitely!
A: Los niños menores de diez años no deberían tener un teléfono móvil. B: No lo creo.
A: Children under the age of ten shouldn't have a mobile phone. B: I don't think so.
A: Nunca encuentro nada que quiera ver en televisión. Todo es basura. B: Estoy de acuerdo.
A: I can never find anything I want to watch on television. It's all rubbish. B: I agree.
A: Todos los policías deberían llevar armas. B: Estoy totalmente en desacuerdo.
A: Policemen should all carry guns. B: I totally disagree.
A: Creo que los sitios para compartir videos pueden ser peligrosos. B: Sí, estoy de acuerdo. Cualquiera puede subir videos de cosas ilegales.
A: I think video sharing sites can be dangerous. B: Yes, I agree. Anyone can upload videos of illegal things.
